intro: Coreopsis borianiana, commonly known as the Borean coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. Coreopsis borianiana thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens or alpine settings.
